docs.lead_paragraph: ALTCHEK--Albert, MD. We at The Mount Sinai Medical Center are deeply saddened by the passing of our dear friend and longtime colleague, Albert Altchek, MD. For 65 years, Dr. Altchek was a physician and faculty member in the Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Science. He published and lectured widely, and was recognized for his expertise in adolescent and pediatric gynecology, as well as renal biopsies in patients with hypertensive disorders of pregnancy. Dedicated to family, patients, and residents, Dr. Altchek is survived by several family members, including 11 fellow physicians. We will miss this educator, clinician, and gentleman. Peter W. May, Chairman, Boards of Trustees, The Mount Sinai Medical Center; Kenneth L. Davis, MD, President and Chief Executive Officer, The Mount Sinai Medical Center; Dennis S. Charney, MD, Anne and Joel Ehrenkranz Dean of Mount Sinai School of Medicine and Executive Vice President for Academic Affairs, The Mount Sinai Medical Center; and Michael L. Brodman, MD, Professor and Chairman, The Ellen and Howard C. Katz Chairman's Chair, Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Science.

docs.lead_paragraph: We are covering the final season of “Friday Night Lights” according to the NBC schedule. We ask that readers who have already seen the season on DirecTV or on DVD to please refrain from giving away future plot points in the comments section.Can this child be saved? That was the underlying theme of the latest episode of “Friday Night Lights,” as we watched Epyck lash out, fight and get suspended and Buddy’s son roll into town with his quasi-vegan-induced anger and disillusionment. Who among us wouldn’t become cranky if subjected to a step-parent mandated diet of seitan? It seems to take Buddy Jr. about 10 seconds of being in Dillon to steal his father’s credit card and break into the booze and another 20 for everyone to figure that the cure for what ails Buddy is going to be two-a-days. I’m already feeling too optimistic about Buddy’s future, and I don’t want to feel optimistic. I hope for more screeching engines and rebellion, a challenge to Buddy’s narrowly circumscribed gridiron view of the world.

headline.main: ‘Friday Night Lights’ Watch: Save the Children

docs.abstract: “Friday Night Lights,” which has been so entrenched in ideas surrounding absent fathers, is spending its final season in the territory of paternal healing.
docs.snippet: “Friday Night Lights,” which has been so entrenched in ideas surrounding absent fathers, is spending its final season in the territory of paternal healing.

docs.lead_paragraph: The successful MTV reality series “Teen Mom” will continue to follow the four young parents this year as they exit their teenage years and as their children grow up.

headline.main: MTV to Keep Eye Trained On Families of ‘Teen Mom’

docs.abstract: MTV announced on Wednesday that it had ordered a fourth season of the series, indicating its confidence that viewers want to keep up with Maci, Farrah, Catelynn and Amber as they and their children get older.
docs.snippet: MTV announced on Wednesday that it had ordered a fourth season of the series, indicating its confidence that viewers want to keep up with Maci, Farrah, Catelynn and Amber as they and their children get older.

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman dies in childbirth every 90 seconds or so somewhere in the world. Mother’s Day is a chance to help end these preventable deaths.

docs.lead_paragraph: While you make your brunch plans, and search through racks of cards praising Mom, take a moment to remember that there are many places where it is dangerous to be a mother.
docs.abstract: A reminder that most of our daily struggles are real luxuries.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers lately have learned that serotonin plays an impressive number of critical roles throughout the body.

headline.seo: Serotonin, Our Utility Hormone, Still Surprises
headline.main: Job Description Grows for Our Utility Hormone
headline.print_headline: Job Description Grows For Our Utility Hormone

docs.snippet: Researchers lately have learned that serotonin plays an impressive number of critical roles throughout the body.

docs.lead_paragraph: Just when you thought that serotonin was passé, and you'd tossed all your half-used bottles of S.S.R.I.-type antidepressants because the ones that didn't give you nausea or smother your libido left you wondering whether you were in the placebo arm of a clinical trial, here comes a raft of new discoveries that sweeps the small, evolutionarily ancient and slyly powerful signaling molecule back on to center stage. Researchers lately have learned that serotonin plays an impressive number of critical roles throughout the body, both below the neck and above it, and from the earliest days of prenatal pre-sentience. One team has found that serotonin starts seeping into the embryonic forebrain during the first trimester of pregnancy, helping to shape the basic neural circuitry that later in life will be applied to learning, emoting and consulting a psychiatrist.

headline.main: Job Description Grows For Our Utility Hormone

docs.abstract: Study in journal Nature finds that the utility hormone seratonin performs impressive number of roles throughout the human body; drawing (M)
